website_summaries.verdict: For those who are wary of low-battery chirps at 3 a.m. or false alarms, Nest's CO and smoke detector may be the solution.
pros: Communicates with other Nest detectors (if installed in the house) as well as Nest cameras
Also integrates with Logitech Harmony and Wink smart home systems
Tells owners verbally what it is detecting
Users love that low battery alert chirps are replaced by a battery life indicator
cons: Does not directly integrate with remote home security providers' systems
Setup can be complex, and connecting to Wi-Fi routers can be problematic

website_summaries.verdict: If you are tech savvy, like the idea of a smart smoke detector, or are eager to add one more device to your smart home, you won't find a better model. Packed with features and offers reliable protection.
pros: Like other Nest products, this combination smoke/CO2 detector is "smart" and compatible with numerous devices
Capable of sending alerts to your smart phone
It's also attractive, and built to last for 10 years
cons: Requires some tech knowledge to set up and use
Some minor issues with the app and Wi-Fi have been reported

website_summaries.verdict: A thorough interactive device that monitors for smoke and CO and delivers definite peace of mind.
pros: Tests air at least 400 times per day
Unit typically lasts for 10 years (longer than average)
cons: CO readings not given in ppm

website_summaries.verdict: Nest brings crisp design and smart features -- connected and otherwise -- to the humble smoke detector. You don't absolutely need the Nest Protect, but it's fine to admit you want one.
pros: With boutique design, remote monitoring via mobile device, and the ability to wave off false alarms with your hand, the Nest Protect is the smoke/CO detector we never knew we wanted
cons: $129 is a lot to ask for a smoke/CO detector, even a connected one

customer_reviews.title: Did not work during a fire. Luckily I had inexpensive detectors which worked.
customer_reviews.text: I received the nest smoke detector January 30, 2018. Installed and tested. On March 9, 2018 some kerosene soaked rags caught on fire in my basement. The house was full of smoke. As I called 911 the inexpensive smoke detectors in my home were going off at the nest was not. Later I checked the app and it said there are no issues. When tested it stills says it is working properly, but obviously it does not. I have to say I do like the thermostat, but I am so disappointed in the smoke detector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: we had a fire and this NEVER wentoff did NOTHING no warning to our cell phone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Patti B

customer_reviews.title: No longer smart WARNING
customer_reviews.text: On May 7, 2019 Alphabet (Google) announced that Nest devices will no longer support "Works with Nest," meaning that any smart features will no longer work (except Google Assistant) effective August 31, 2019. This means that Nest products will no longer work with any of the major smart home devices, including Smartthings, IFTTT, Alexa, and even including the Nest app itself. Since Google routines cannot be triggered by most events, this essentially makes them super expensive dumb devices. Luckily, I bought all of my Nest Protects less than 30 days ago and will be returning them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Can not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: A little over a year old and my unit is possessed. It keeps repeating “Welcome to Nest”. The speaker is very distorted. I ended up having to unplug it and take the batteries out to stop it from talking. Unfortunately I’m outside the warranty. Can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Layne

customer_reviews.title: Bad warehouse deal
customer_reviews.text: Caveat Emptor! This was a warehouse deal, but I didn't realize that the detector was a 2013 model with only five years remaining on its lifespan. When the packaged arrived I could hear the Protect talking. When I unboxed I realized that it had been activated in 2013 and the batteries were running low (probably because the test button had been accidently activated many times. The thing kept making noise all night and at 2 AM I had to disassemble in order to remove the batteries. Returned! I expected more from Amazon quality control which had place a sticker on the box as INSPECTED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: make sure you get it with Manufafture date from current year !
customer_reviews.text: the product was purchased on 10/2019 and the product the was sent was manufactured in 2016 ! nest smoke detector invalid for only 10 years. make sure you receive a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Shachar Simon

customer_reviews.title: Cant return..and not compliant with CA regulations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (2 of them) because it was "Long Life Battery". I thought this would comply with California regulations of a nonremovable battery....a ten year battery. IT doesn't. And the packaging isn't clear that it doesn't... ..Thanks Nest for the misleading packaging...
customer_reviews.author: LoraLee

customer_reviews.title: ONLY LASTED 3 YEARS!
customer_reviews.text: So loved this smoke alarm at first. I could install it and it sent alarm to me on phone vs fire department. And I could decide if I was cooking or not so fire company wouldn't come! ;-) BUT it's 3 years old and it's dead. Yellow light is flashing " END OF LIFE" A 99$ alarm - that's 33$ a year - back to $15 models that last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: ellen dedman

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on 5Ghz, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this protect (and another from a local store) worked ok on my wifi but when I starting having interference issues and my provider switched to a 5Ghz only wifi router the devices stopped. After 1 hour 30 minutes on the phone with Nest I was told my $100 detector was not compatible with 5Ghz, even the Nest person couldn't find this information easily. This is the latest model, supposed to last 10 years still build on old single band tech. The new Nest Thermostat works on dual band. I would avoid this product if you want something that will works with newer tech.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Would be lovely if they weren’t always offline.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this set when we moved into our new house and I want to love them so bad but I can not keep them connected to the internet. We went almost a month before I noticed they weren’t connected. Every time I find they have disconnected themselves, I have to delete them and re add them to my account. One is in the room our WiFi router is in and it still won’t connect! We have no problems with our nest camera which is on the opposite side of the house from our router, or any other electronics for that matter so I can’t understand why these won’t stay connected to our internet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Sloane

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, works with CO monitor
customer_reviews.text: The Nest Smoke Detector (not only smoke!!) detects Carbon Monoxide as well - this detected a CO event with our gas heater 4 years after installation ... we thought initially that the battery was low or something, but the app showed the batteries were OK, it was a fault with the gas heater. If it wasn't detected it could have been all over! Definitely THE BEST 'smoke detector' out there. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gazza

customer_reviews.title: WiFi connected, hardly!
customer_reviews.text: Every time you change your WiFi you have to get it off the ceiling to scan the code and setup every feature over again. App is constantly disconnecting from WiFi. Nearly impossible to ever get app to run and get connected. Even when the Protect and Thermostat are connected to WiFi you can’t get the app to connect to them. Troubleshooting help is nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Markymark327

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my insurance company
customer_reviews.text: My homeowner's insurance company recommended this device, mounted in the furnace room, when used with the Nest app to qualify for a discount. I decided to buy the battery operated detector because the battery life is very long, and therefore rarely needs attention. I bought it for my new home so I can install it quickly and qualify for an insurance discount. Mounting is quick and easy easy and without having to wire anything. The app is unobtrusive, providing a notification once per month when the self-test is activated. Note, the device does not have motion detection, it detects whether you are home or away for home-safety reasons; this feature being required by the insurance company.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Hardware Design Needs Work
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Google Nest and use several of their products in my home. Setup and installation are simple; customer support (if needed) is outstanding. My only complaint is the hardware design for Nest Protect should be improved. During installation, once you've mounted the ceiling hardware and connected the main unit, you align the mounting tabs and rotate the unit to lock it in place. One of my tabs wasn't aligned and snapped off. I contacted Google to see if that part could be replaced and the answer was "no". The design and quality of materials must be more robust for the do-it-yourself'ers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R

customer_reviews.title: Always ringing and making noise when there is no smoke
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot of electronics and I believe this is the worst device I have ever bought. From time to time it just starts saying there is smoke in the living room where there is no smoke in the living room. The worst is when that happens in the middle of the night and wakes you up. After a while, I just threw the device out in the trash can because of so many false alarms. Completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Luc C.

customer_reviews.title: Select your language carefully!
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally selected the wrong language during set up because apparently you need to push the button very quickly for English. I figured out how to update the language in Settings, but it says it will take up to a day to update. I listen to the rest of the set up dialogue in Spanish. I believe it will be quicker to return it and buy a new one then to wait for the setting to take affect. Pretty bizarre and relatively minor issue, but if there was a fire or carbon monoxide detected I won’t really know what it is saying.
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: Nightlight with benefits
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a Nest Protect because I thought it would be a great addition to our Nest Thermostat. I ended up replacing every smoke detector in the house because my wife thought it was an excellent nightlight. The Protects are very convenient because they can be set to turn on only when they sense motion, avoiding constant illumination throughout the night. They also integrate nicely into the Nest app and website by allowing easy to understand status and history checks. The second generation Nest Protects are much easier to install than the first generation and only take a few harmless minutes to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION:  Limited App Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I burned some toast. Alarm went off as expected. NO notification from app and NO way to turn off alarm from app? I contacted tech support and they confirmed that you have to push the Nest button to turn off alarm? Well guess what? My units are on 12 foot ceilings.... What is the purpose of the app if I can't get notifications and turn off alarms? App never indicated that the small alarm when off? Serious flaw in product design if the app can't interface for recognizing false alarms and allow you to override.... Whats to point in buying a product like this then over a standard smoke alarm?
customer_reviews.author: Gary Menichini

customer_reviews.title: False Alarm! Won't stop as well!
customer_reviews.text: Was enjoying a football game at the stadium, suddenly I get an alarm from nest on my iPhone. I rush to home after calling some relatives to see if there are any smoke from my house. After arriving, surprise no fire or smoke at all. Nest is still sounding the alarm continuously. I press the silent button and nest says that smoke is too high. I can't even silence the device. I bring in the ladder, remove the nest from the ceiling and remove the battery. NOT STOPPING? Unplug the battery for half an hour and finally decided to stop the alarm! Wow, never expected this from nest, very disappointing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Thank you net smoke detector
customer_reviews.text: Thank you net smoke detector! I keep getting scarred because my dad would sometimes a while leave the stove burner on. And he would leave for a job. And I would be sleeping during the day because I work overnights. Then I wake up to my baby sister screaming at me "SMOKE!!!! SMOKE!!!! WAKEUP!!! SMOKE!!!" and the house is just filled with smoke. Then I tell my baby sister to go outside while I find the source, yap stove burner left on... This happen plenty times. Now hopefully I can relax a little bit. Especially when I am at work away from home. I am still just edgy.
customer_reviews.author: Tyee Cambron

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. I wanted smoke detectors that would alert me when I was out of the house. The detector is not very sensitive. In addition to that, the detector takes only one kind of AA batteries. They run through batteries quickly and do not work with rechargeable batteries. This to me is a recipe for a non working smoke detector. I think there must be better options out there. I’m a renter so I can’t hardwire my smoke detectors in which is why I was drawn to this in the first place but sadly I don’t think it works well enough to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mandm66

customer_reviews.title: Works and super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought these immediately after I realized my basement furnace's exhaust basically just 'fell' off. Luckily, I happened to be in the basement when it happened and had some duct tape to get back into place. This was a wake up call as to the importance of having a carbon monoxide alarm in the house. These Nest Protects filled the bill and don't require a hardwiring to install. So I feel much safer with these in all 3 levels of my house now. These also have the added benefit of including a night light function which was a pleasant surprise. It's motion sensitive too so it'll only come on when someone is near by.
customer_reviews.author: Zsoldier

customer_reviews.title: 3 Hours of tech help and still not installed
customer_reviews.text: Without any pre-warning, Nest will not deal with a Google -G-Suite account -- in which google hosts your domain name. After connecting to a seldom-used OK gamail.com account, it would not allow second member of household to be invited - thus no control on iPhone. After being told that said member needed own Nest account --nowhere in install instructions-- and it being set up, the invitation still failed. After being told to delete app, reboot and start again, the new, CO, device could not be found by the app. Gave up and Returned product Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Plain English

customer_reviews.title: Good product but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the hardwire product to replace our current smoke detectors. It is very easy to install, all you need is a standard screwdriver. My only disappointment is that the product video shiws the motion nightlight as being much brighter than it actually is. On its brightest setting, it is about as bright as a dimly lit candle. I bought this product because of the product video ans thought the nightlight would be helpful for my elderly mother but it is as bright as a lit match.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Crabb

customer_reviews.title: Google made replacement very difficult
customer_reviews.text: I have seven Nest Protect 1's in my house, all purchased before Google commandeered Nest. One of the devices has now started giving false alarms, of course the one 26' up in an atrium. I bought a Nest 2 to replace the Nest 1. Google changed the mount and the plug, so at the top of a very tall ladder I have to take the old mounting plate and plug off and install/rewire. A replacement process that takes as long as a new install instead of a 30 second unplug/plug. Had I known Google was going to buy Nest I never would have purchased the system.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Island

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Owned a previous version for 2 years and it worked okay—batteries died all the time, so purchased this new one. Bought Feb 25, it is now April 6 and for the past week it has been getting a smoke sensor fault. Blew off and cleaned and it worked for a few days then comes back. Must be a faulty sensor. Return window is only 30 days so now I am out $120 and don’t have a smoke alarm that works. Very disappointed and will never purchase another nest product again if this is not somehow resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Al pal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: While the other Nest products I own work perfectly, these do NOT. They cannot maintain wifi connectivity and after upgrading my router, I'm left with Nest support claiming the problem lies with our internet provider, although all the other Nest products updated perfectly. Nest just throws their arms up and says 'sorry'. Now I have really expensive smoke detectors in my home. I would recommend avoiding these. No problems with other Nest products though.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Google ruined whatever thses had left
customer_reviews.text: So recently Google force Nest owners to move their accounts to Google / gmail and the new Nest app requires Android 5 >. Since the tablet I own is Adroid 4.4 this has left my Nest investment USELESS. PROVES THERE IS NOTHING THAT GOOGLE CAN'T RUIN
customer_reviews.author: Tasker

customer_reviews.title: Tells you what room alarm is in - Great for visually Impaired
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a number of years. Very good performance and I like that I can reset alarms from my iPhone. The installation was somewhat difficult, but nest customer support walked me through it. I am visually impaired, so the one feature where it tells you where the fire is is so important. It lets me know how to exit correctly I. I wish the iOS app for Nest supported voiceover. that is the accessibility feature for The blind. The batteries only need to be replaced every five years. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Should have checked app reviews first
customer_reviews.text: Set up seemed uneventful but now that it’s installed the app says the unit is offline. Multiple uninstall/reinstall, wifi check, and going through the setup haven’t solved anything. I wish I’d read the app reviews before I ordered because the latest version appears to be a disaster, which my experience matches.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Interconnect feature if you have more than one
customer_reviews.text: Really like these and recommend highly. Easy to install, beautiful lights, easy to configure, great phone app, AND best of all the interconnect feature. We were cooking steak and one of the alarms voiced out that we were reaching high levels of smoke. After a few seconds, there was even more smoke in the room so all the best alarms in the house went off. Very nice feature to all go at the same time. Hushing one of the alarms was enough to deactivate all other alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Buatkokk

customer_reviews.title: Defected features
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine until kept on reminding me to change the batteries and I just bought this so me being a jerk I change the batteries and 10 minutes later it’s asking me to change the batteries again and I threw the first batteries away that I should’ve returned with the item anyhow it doesn’t work it keeps asking me to change the batteries
customer_reviews.author: BillyNYC

customer_reviews.title: Fails in less than 3 years, warranty is only for two - Cost $40/year of service
customer_reviews.text: Use to love this, but unit (wired) just went crazy just one day after Nest Protect self test says fine. The Nest Protect just went crazy, Light ring not working msg, Smoke when no smoke, making strange noises gear like noises, say "Replace Nest Protect Now" - online help only talks about 10-year replacement, not if malfunctions. No help at all, no one to call either. Took wired unit down and noticed it was hot? Fire hazard? removed batteries. This is a very expensive smoke detector if you need to replace it every 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: JayD

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation, Fully Online in Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Customizable self testing for certain times of day. Super easy to install and add to wifi by scanning QR code and set-up steps. Online within minutes. Lights up path at night. Easy app to interface with system and ensure it is good to go. Con's: Any changes to wifi/router require you to delete from the app and reinstall, which means taking them down again to scan the QR code on the hidden backside of the unit. Still only a few minutes of your time.
customer_reviews.author: MBDTRHSC

customer_reviews.title: Family was involved!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased during COVID when my old battery smoke alarms went out. I don’t have a wired system and this networked flawlessly with my Nest thermostat. Having the additional information for self checks is a huge positive especially knowing I can handle the battery issue before 2 am beeping happens. My sons were exited and wanted to ‘test’ the unit. I highly recommend this unit, and company, as I have been using Nest thermostats since they cane out. While I know this unit is for the smoke/fire alarm, I felt a picture showing the earning of ‘leaves’ because of my thermostat, during my workdays, might be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Done with this product never again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product 2 years and 2 months ago. Warrantee is 2 years at 2 years 2 months it started chirping once a minute. Talked tech support and they said I needed new batteries. These batteries are $15 a pack of 8. I bought new ones put them in and it started chirping again every minute. Called back tec support and they said to get more batteries and try again. Well I did now I am $30 into batteries and I still have a detector that chirps once a minute. Done with these for good.
customer_reviews.author: tlcx

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from this seller!
customer_reviews.text: Received working Nest Protect, no issue there. However as these are intended to last 10 years from date of manufacture (and will actually alert at that point), and the one I received is >3.5 years old, it’s 65% consumed already. Reached out to the seller via amazon for a 35% discount or a fresh replacement and got no response. Pain in the ass, better for you to just find another seller. I’m surprised anyone even has 3 and a half year old versions of a popular product but I guess this seller does.
customer_reviews.author: Peter E

customer_reviews.title: No wired interconnect therefore incompatible with existing detectors.
customer_reviews.text: The smoke detector is "wired" for power and that is all. There's no third wire for the interconnect. In their defense Nest offers up the benefits of having wireless interconnect on their web site, however, there's one glaring problem. They do not offer a wired interconnect like the Halo smart smoke and CO detectors we're slowly replacing. That means you'd have to replace them all at once. In fairly modern house that means replacing up to 10 of these at once. Additionally, Google has changed their interface so that the no longer integrate with SmartThings.
customer_reviews.author: LotusEater

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, glad I spent the extra money!
customer_reviews.text: Love the night light when you move under. I set this up in my living room and hallway. Its not a bright blinding light and doesn't mess with your night vision. A gentle light that still lights your way. Its a great addition to what its actual function is. Was very easy to install and add to my app that I already have a nest thermostat and yale door lock on. If your looking for a carbon monoxide and smoke detector this one will beat what others do and has other capabilities. Spend the extra money and you won't be disappointed. As well as you will get a great name brand with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dedra & DJ

customer_reviews.title: Best smoke and co2 detector
customer_reviews.text: I don’t see why people have negative reviews, these work great. I got the battery powered which lets u install them wherever u want. I like how when there is smoke it warns u so u can turn off the siren before it goes off, no likes to hear the piercing fire alarms, also it’s nice not to have to stand on a chair to get the alarm to stop. The nest also has another nice feature at night time. It’s a pathway feature that senses motion and lights up the area so u can see but without turning on any lights
customer_reviews.author: brent mills

customer_reviews.title: Old stock items sold with 5 year life gone
customer_reviews.text: these units have 10 year life. I just purchase a unit via alwayz on sale and the unit arrived 5 years after is was manufactured. I am not paying for old stock items with 50% of the life gone. batteries were dead and would not setup via app. buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: J Time

customer_reviews.title: Total crap. Useless support. can not connect to network
customer_reviews.text: I had two perfectly working nest protects. after changing to the google account : both are non responsive. I deleted them from the account. Rese tthem ,reinstalled app , rebooted phone. nothing works. trying to re-add them fails with P002 2049 error code. i tried for hours. i can not reactive them. Support is useless.
customer_reviews.author: vincent himpe

customer_reviews.title: False alarm
customer_reviews.text: It was working fine initially but since the last week, there have been 3 or 4 times it just started to malfunction. It rings on smoke and it drove my dogs crazy scared. There were no smoke...nothing...but it wouldn't stop. I tried reset, check for update, nothing works. I unplugged it already. Unless there's a way to stop the false alarm, I'm not plugging this thing back in anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Miss B.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Short - Replacements cost $30
customer_reviews.text: Had this device less than a year when the low battery warning sounded. Seemed like short life but replace with Energizer MAX batteries. Warning sounded three nights later (waking us up). Called and was told I must replace with Energizer CR123A lithium batteries, and any other alkaline will rapidly deplete. Checking online for those batteries now and see that two cost $9.99. So $29.97 plus tax to replace batteries that will less than a year. Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: Countrygirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup no maintenance!
customer_reviews.text: It gives you a piece of mind to have this in home. I'm comforted to know that I can receive alerts on my phone and in some cases insurance companies will give you a discount if you have these! Overall Nest was so easy to set up, test, and maintain. We've already had the system go off when burgers burned in a pan. First it gave us the "yellow" heads up warning about smoke and as the smoke got thicker, we got the "red" emergency alert. It was easy to silence the alarm (and then air out the house.) It immediately sent a notification to my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Mpele

customer_reviews.title: Don't support Google G Suite accounts and don't tell you that on the packaging
customer_reviews.text: Please look at the forums on the nest website. You'll see just how terrible Nest customer service and support it. Unfortunately, Google has taken another great idea and turned it into a way to spy on their products (customers) and profit from selling their information. There is an article online saying how the Nest CEO even said you should let guests know that any Nest device with a microphone is recording them. Just look it up online. Yikes.
customer_reviews.author: osaga

customer_reviews.title: If you want a smoke detector that has 5 years left before replacement this is for you
customer_reviews.text: I owned the 1st generation of nest smoke detector, we sold the house and left the unit with it. Went and bought the same detector on amazon, after 2 hours trying to install from different phones, accounts, resetting to factory settings, restarting devices, replacing the batteries it never worked! Amazon chat 💭 said it was a defective unit. Went to look on the unit serial number and this is been sitting at the warehouse for 5 years 😤 very disappointed. Do to covid-19 you cant communicate with best which is owned by google.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Nice Features
customer_reviews.text: Have had 2 false alarms occur over several months, disturbing lots of neighbors in our condo complex. Always at night. Otherwise, it seems to work and tests fine. Like the lighted exit assist feature that illuminates at night when it senses motion, nice feature. Monthly reports are nice too, especially the battery condition feature. Integrates easily with our Abode Security System, but false alarms are amplified by Abodes response to the smoke alarm. We self monitor, but this would be a real problem if we professionally monitored and the false alarms triggered a fire department response.
customer_reviews.author: 0bnxshs

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Item, no more beep - beep - beep
customer_reviews.text: Loved how easy they were to set up. We bought 6 and they all linked up easily. The one big draw back is you cannot lable the rooms individually, ie Kids bedroom, Moms room, a bedroom is just a bedroom. We bought the lithium Ion battery version over the wired, even though we have wires available. My wife loves the way they look, we both like the night light option and the fact that I can check from my phone. You can even program in emergency contact info so if they go off, the number automatically shows on your phone. Again, money very well spent
customer_reviews.author: David Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a year
customer_reviews.text: For the first year of owning the alarm, everything worked okay. I had one or two false alarms but overall when we burned something cooking it warned us on the phone which was great. Well after that year the Nest Protect just died. I am nothing, no lights, no sound, no connection to the mobile app. Worst of all, I was never given a warning that the app had lost connection with the Nest alarm so I thought it was working fine. If it wasn't for a check I never would have known it wasn't working. My $10 CO/fire alarm works for 10 years, this one barely lasted a year.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Great smoke detectors!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted to try these smoke detectors for awhile and finally bought a set of three for the house. They work great and the connectivity between them is a super great feature. We had some smoke in house the other day from cooking and they told us there was smoke and which room it was in. When we cleared the smoke it told us the smoke was clearing. That is a great feature!! The self testing provides piece of mind that your smoke detectors are working and the report let's you know when the test was done and it it was successful. They are pricey but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: tscheese

customer_reviews.title: High tech detectors.
customer_reviews.text: Already had one upstairs. Wanted another downstairs. Probably will add more. The two communicate with each other via bluetooth. I believe they talk to the Nest thermostat which connects with the wifi. The units I purchased use 4 lithium AA batteries. The 1st is still running on the original batteries after 3 years. Typical? Don't know. Has 2 types of sensors for heat or smoke. Detects carbon monoxide. Lights the hall softly in the night. Self checks with built in microphones. They're not listening to you though, they say.
customer_reviews.author: RWalker

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative alarm for homes with dogs
customer_reviews.text: So far this unit hasn’t been needed yet so I can’t speak to the alerting. It was easy to setup! I purchased it because our dog freaks out when our old carbon monoxide or fire alarm would either go off or make the battery chirping sound. After the last false alarm I looked to see what connected to the internet and found this device. Now if the alarm goes off I and I’m not home but my dog is, I can silence it and either rush home, call the neighbors or call 911 and my dog won’t be as stressed because of the horrible sound alarms make. Pretty excited about this device.
customer_reviews.author: Aspenexcel

customer_reviews.title: Nestless
customer_reviews.text: The serial number said December 17, 2015 - we in 2020. The dead batteries confirmed that this thing was stored away for 5 years. It didn’t connect to the WiFi network ether (I have 5 Ubiquiti HD Nanos, and there are no dead spots in the house). After replacing the batteries, I made 20 attempts to connect - I kept getting errors. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Money

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good until Google
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 5 Nest Protects for 5 years and have had no problems until this year. I’ve had 2 incidents (1 a false) and the other a CO alarm. Both times I was unable to access my Nest app because Google wanted me to migrate from Nest to Google accounts. So with that said, the app is totally worthless in case of an incident. Also, anytime you have an incident, be prepared to replace all the batteries in all the units and the batteries aren’t cheap and are not stocked in every store. Battery life is greatly exaggerated but what else can you expect from “data breach” Google?
customer_reviews.author: Dodger Fan

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Must Be Replaced Every Three Months!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had to replace the batteries five times already in all four alarms. Our ceilings are 10 ft and it is a chore to change them. Worst product on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Booking in GA

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and installed this in December 2019. All has gone well until June when unit started alarming and stating the smoke sensor has failed and need to replace the unit. Followed the guidelines to clean the unit and a day or so goes by and repeats the same alarm and warning. This last time I changed out the batteries but no help. It is now July and I will replace this with some other brand that actually works and does not give false alarms. It plainly states the unit should last 10 years but I only get 6 months. This is truly a piece of crap. Shame on Google for marketing such a failure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage, connected to WiFi once, then never again
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage, this connected to WiFi once for set up, then was never able to connect again, even after multiple resets of both the device itself and my WiFi router (all other WiFi devices on my network are working normal). You're better off with a non-WiFi smoke and carbon monoxide detector. Avoid this garbage. It didn't even come with drywall anchors, something that basically all other $30 smoke detectors include.
customer_reviews.author: Mediahound 🎧

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I love Nest and I love these smoke detectors. I wish they were a little more affordable but in the past two years I've bought 8 of these for my house. Probably overkill but I have them all throughout the house and I enjoy being able to check my app to make sure they're all working properly. They're all synced up as well so it definitely lets you know when there is smoke in the house. Great product, it looks very clean when mounted as well.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chappy

customer_reviews.title: It will fail on you, don't trust the quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of those 2nd gen, supposedly you should not have false alarms, but you will get false alarms in the middle of the night. Support just said they can't do anything because it's out of warranty. Do yourself a favor, buy something cheaper that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: flimay2k

customer_reviews.title: Does not detect smoke
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst. We’ve had for 3 years don’t know if they’ve actually ever worked, with smoke in kitchen they’ve never gone off. Then during fires in our area, i noticed they were offline. I had my husband test them by putting smoke up to them. Didn’t even go off with a lot of smoke. Such a waste of money as we have 2 homes that have them. Switching back to regular smoke and carbon monoxide detectors right away. Not a good product from Nest
customer_reviews.author: ryan polisky

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, listen to everyone that complained about false alarms
customer_reviews.text: This is a garbage, few months after I bought it, started giving false smoke alarms on daily basis which can't even be disabled. Sorry, I don't want to start doing electricity work at 3am and detach nest from electricity but that's the ONLY way to make it shut up. Very "smart" alarm that doesn't even give you a way to reasonably handle malfunction. Not the first problem I have work nest products, their quality is poor and completely ruining Google brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shamis

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Really neat. I held off purchasing these for a while, because I thought what as the point, but they're really cool. They have an automatic motion sensing night light. When I had smoke in the kitchen this weekend I was able to silence them from my phone. Try to do that with a regular battery smoke detector and you'll find yourself on a chair to take the batteries out. I also like that it will talk to you and tell you what's going on along with the alarm. "warning there is smoke in the kitchen. The alarm will sound. The alarm is loud." Then it kicks off. It would be nice if they had water sensors with this too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deleonardo

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product
customer_reviews.text: The battery alarm goes off constantly and Google/Nest do nothing to address the hundreds of people reporting problems for years. Do not buy this product. It’s defective and google is doing nothing about it.
customer_reviews.author: jcb321

customer_reviews.title: Great item for your smart home needs.
customer_reviews.text: I love the nest smoke detector. I’m able to monitor smoke alarms remotely using their easy-to-use app. Batteries also come with the product which is a rarity these days, what’s also great is that the batteries last up to 10 years with no changing required. My only complaint is the price, But that’s what happens when you’re the only product in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Si

customer_reviews.title: Nest Protect now integrates with Homekit with Starling Hub
customer_reviews.text: I got sick and tired of phantom beeps coming from my First Alert Smoke detectors. I was reluctant to install Nest Protects since I wanted detectors that work with Homekit. I learned of the Starling Hub that integrates Nest products with Homekit. I changed out the First Alerts with Nest. The install was real easy as was the install of the Starling Hub. Now I see the Nest's in Homekit and I can create automations In Homekit for them. I also like the pathway light that comes on at night.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Go to for smart smoke and carbon monoxide alarm
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these throughout my house. They are a set it and forget it type of device. I had a 1st gen before that would always disconnect and have issues. And that was the wired version. I'm now using the battery version and no issues at all. Just added one to another room we finished up and everything went just as smooth as the other 4. Haven't had a reason to have it go off (and pray I never do), but I feel safer knowing it will be there to protect me and my family if it does.
customer_reviews.author: Kevlar

customer_reviews.title: Beware of 2 year warranty, maybe built to last only two years.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 2016. Exactly two years later, around September 2018 (just as the warranty expired) we started noticing the low battery warning was suddenly going off far too soon since the last battery change. After the third battery warning in two months, we’ve finally accepted the fact that it’s dead. Either way we can’t continue to deal with the low battery alert in the middle of the night, waking the family every month. We are happily going back to the less expensive and reliable brands without all the bells and whistles. Wanted to love it and bought it because of all the claims that it can last up to ten years. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: umma_lee

customer_reviews.title: Being able to silence the alarm from my phone is super convenient. The small light that it turns on ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have false fire alarms while cooking nearly daily. After months of having this, it's had no false alarms and has actually responded perfectly to a real small fire that began on our stove. Being able to silence the alarm from my phone is super convenient. The small light that it turns on as I pass under it in the dark has prevented a lot of stubbed toes too. Overall I'm satisfied with this and if my house were larger I'd consider replacing all of my fire alarms with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kale Hase

customer_reviews.title: It's been 7 months now and still no false alarms. Nice!
customer_reviews.text: It's been 7 months now and still no false alarms. We replaced one of our old hard wired detectors because every once in a while (Maybe twice every 2-3 months) it would just go off for 10 seconds. We have small dogs that absolutely freak out at that sound and it was driving us crazy. We tried other detectors and the result was the same. Then we saw this and thought at least maybe the voice would not scare the dogs so much but it has not yet faulted so we're feeling good about it. Wish it was a tad cheaper, but it is worth it to us and the night lite is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J Cage

customer_reviews.title: Category Leader Delivers a Great Experience
customer_reviews.text: Nest has come into some criticism of late that they haven't innovated sufficiently in their market space, but it should be said that they are shipping products with Apple-like quality and un-boxing experience, and it appears that people are gobbling them up. Our kids put Nest Protect devices in their home, and I enjoyed having the way lit as I got up at night when staying over in their house. We recently found several of our smoke detectors had aged out when we went about changing batteries this winter, so we bought this one. We have now purchased three more to replace the others that have died. I can't recommend these items enough, they are terrific.
customer_reviews.author: BAABBS

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind for a Crazy Dog Lady
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had occasion to use it but I’m really glad to have a detector with notification capabilities. My dog is home alone while I’m at work all day and I started having horrible thoughts about what would happen if a lamp/etc caught fire and nobody knew to call 911. It gives me peace of mind that I can call them myself or a neighbor if I get an alert. This is my first smart home device so i can’t say how well it plays with others but the Nest app is nice and does an alarm test once a month. It also doesn’t hurt that this detector looks GORGEOUS on my ceiling! Understated but beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: LeighesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good detectors, horrible app.
customer_reviews.text: The detectors work fine. The Nest app however, is really substandard. I have 7 of these in my home, and when my wifi router had to be replaced, there's no method if switching wifi's in the app. You actually have to delete the products in the app, then remove each product from the ceiling to scan the barcode, then reinstall it on the ceiling. This app is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: BCL

customer_reviews.title: Delivered with only 70% of lifespan left.
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised but delivered with three years already gone from its 10 year life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replace Batteries every 2 Weeks? Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these, and two of the three require the batteries to be replaced every two weeks, while the other (at another property) lasts about 6 weeks. 6 weeks is horrible. 2 weeks? Not sure there is a word for it. In short, these things suck.
customer_reviews.author: R. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Sleek looking with loads of features...
customer_reviews.text: The really nice thing about these detectors is that you get a voice warning from the device, BEFORE it sounds the alarm - meaning you can silence the alarm from the device, or the app. If all you want is a smoke detector, this isn't for you. If you want something that looks good, and provides additional features, consider this device. Seamlessly integrates with the Nest app. I just hope that I can trust Google with my personal data :0/
customer_reviews.author: RoR

customer_reviews.title: So impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We just installed our Protects a couple weeks ago and inadvertently were able to test them tonight. A utensil melted in our dishwasher and the smoke was enough to set off the Protect. It loudly alerted "EMERGENCY. SMOKE. DOWNSTAIRS". I was relieved that it was just a melted utensil and so impressed that the Protect was able to detect a relatively minor amount of smoke and sound the alert specifically and promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Mia's Mom

customer_reviews.title: A First-Rate Quality Product, But It's Expensive
customer_reviews.text: These units are perfectly dependable and beautifully designed. They never give us a false alarm and are completely unobtrusive. But the most surprising feature is their motion-sensitive nightlights. We didn't realize how useful they would be. When getting up for a sleep-interrupting bathroom break, the little Nest Protects all glow and light the way. Delightful! I installed seven of them in our house, and it was easier than I thought it would be. The test procedure is actually fun; hearing them briefly engaging all over the house and then controlling them with an iPhone app is a kick. Buy with confidence. This is a first-rate quality product, albeit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. WhiteTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: The fire and CO alarm I didn’t know I needed.
customer_reviews.text: More money then most all other smoke and CO detectors out there but definitely a high quality procuct. I purchased it mainly for the smart features it offers and other reviews. This device came nicely packaged, is sleek, and well built. Installation was also a breeze. Bonus points for the motion activated night light that I didn’t even know was a feature. Will be replacing more detectors in my house with these.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! More than 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product I order a 2nd one as soon as the first one was installed. Installation was fast & simple. The nest fit perfectly over the spots where the hard wired smoke alarms had been. The app is easy to install on your phone & it is straightforward to navigate. The nest has a circle that lights up when the room is dark so that you can see it clearly. I would recommend this product to anyone & everyone. I am beyond impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gallimore

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sends "new" 2 year old smoke alarm
customer_reviews.text: I bought three brand new ones at full price. Once delivered I found that one was manufactured 2 years ago and the other 1 year ago. These products stop working after ten years so this matters a lot. This should have been reflected in the price or at least we'll communicated when purchased. I would not recommend this product to be purchased through Amazon. Go to a store where you can check the serial number which indicates the date of manufacture. The date is also clearly written on the back of the smoke alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but 2 year old stock? Sold by Amazon?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 3 pack of Nest smoke Detectors in September 2020, but they're 2 years old. Made Sept 2018, expire Sept 2028. Twenty percent of their life is done before selling. Other than that they are fine, app works well
customer_reviews.author: DaveD

customer_reviews.title: Love the Protect!
customer_reviews.text: It's pricey for what it is and if you want to fill a whole house with them, be ready to open your wallet. But, I've been very happy with the purchase. It looks great and so far has worked flawlessly since being set up. Setting it up was easy by just following the instructions or even going to youtube to figure it out. I have the wired one and have no electrical experience but safely put it up in about 15 minutes. Overall, the peace of mind having the alert on your phone if you're away was is amazing, the daily tests to ensure it's working is better than a normal alarm and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Peiser

customer_reviews.title: Service life NOT as specified in description.
customer_reviews.text: The Specifications in the product listing say "10 YEAR LIFESPAN." I bought two and they both were manufactured over a year ago and have set on the shelf since. They MUST be replaced 10 years AFTER THEY ARE MANUFACTURED, so I get less than NINE years of service life. SEE PHOTO. At these prices, you should get what you pay for. I HAVE RETURNED BOTH.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it due to factory defect
customer_reviews.text: We received a second unit since the initial device was defective and would not stop beeping after install. We tried resetting it, called customer service twice, and they were unable to resolve the issue. Hoping that the replacement unit will work.
customer_reviews.author: A Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Constant changing of batteries!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hoping this will make others aware...the NEST S3000BWES Carbon Monox./Smoke Detector is nice to look at and provides light at night by motion but that's ALL I can say about it. I have the detector that requires 6 batteries. The detector goes through batteries faster than I can type this out for my review. I've had to switch out the batteries every month and a half, to two months. I would NOT EVER buy a NEST product again for this reason! I paid enough for it on top of that! I'd certainly choose a CHEAPER smoke detector/carbon monox. unit! I plan to further write NEST too, if I can find where to email to. G. Douglaston Pkwy. Douglaston, NY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sensitive to odd things, like humidifiers
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this is great. Except that it thinks the humidifier in our room is smoke after the door has been closed for more than a few hours. Then, it wakes us up at 12 am. On one hand, I feel reassured that in the event of a fire we would all be properly warned. On the other hand, I think it's a wee bit overreactive. Luckily, you can silence the alarm via the phone app or the detector itself. I also like that it's not as terrifyingly annoying as the typical alarm shriek. I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't for the nightly household wake-up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, has a great nightlight feature that our kids love for late at night. The installation took about 20 minutes and so far we have felt safe with the use. Would buy it again if they get an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: ScottE

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Love the silence feature.
customer_reviews.text: Our old alarm near our kitchen would go off when we would cook occasionally which meant to silence it we would have fan a towel to clear the smoke. With the nest protect app we can now silence the alarm when it is about to go off. It will alert you by announcing the alarm is about to go off and you have about 10-15 seconds to silence it before it does. The alarm is loud and will alert you on your phone when it is going off. This is great for when you are away on want peace of mind. We have had it installed for a couple of months now and have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Deaf-friendly product
customer_reviews.text: Nest Protect works wonderful as a smoke detector, and carbon monoxide. However I have to give it a 3 stars because after Google took Nest over, they provoked third party feature which allowed smart lights to work with this product. As a deaf person, we relied on the lights to flash when nest protect goes off. Google took that away!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: It may be a great product is it worked
customer_reviews.text: I wasted a whole evening trying to install without success. I previously easily installed the NEST thermostat so I was shocked with this outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The one "smart" item in my house that gives me no issues on the daily. Aside from the critical life saving aspects of this item, I totally appreciate the night light feature when it senses movement. Hopefully, if I ever have the misfortune to need the fire or carbon monoxide to work as intended, it does.
customer_reviews.author: Joy72

customer_reviews.title: These works great and I would recommend these to anyone with a smart home
customer_reviews.text: I love the Nest Protect smoke and carbon system. I already have the nest thermostat and I love that if this nest protects detect smoke or a possible fire they can shut off the heater. I love that get notifications to alert me of them running a sound check, It tells you if it detects smoke or carbon and in what room. The only reason why I give this product 4 out of 5 stars is that it detects my fiance's hot showers as smoke. She takes really hot/steamy showers which can alert the Nest Protect, It is easy enough to silence the notification through the Nest App though or by just pushing the silence button on it.
customer_reviews.author: Vantheman00

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that one of seven came with dead battery
customer_reviews.text: It may be a good product (I hope so, since I installed sevenj, but there is no excuse for one of the batteries being absolutely dead, which complicated installation. That is, it took much longer than expected, since I had to troubleshoot the nonfunctional unit. Finally realized one battery was absolutely dead. There’s really no excuse for that. It’s also hard to understand why they use six AA batteries in eac unit. That’s 42 batteries for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Winelover

customer_reviews.title: Nest Protect, 2nd generation
customer_reviews.text: Nice smoke-CO detector, but pricy compared to other brands. Took about 4 hours to install 6 devices, which included unpacking, labeling, removing old detectors, and wiring new detectors. Definitely an upgrade over the previous generation of (dumb) smoke detectors. Deducted 2 stars because the device received was manufactured in October 2017, one year ago. Hence, lost one year out of 10 year life already. Purchased 4 more at Costco and 1 more at Lowes, and all those were manufactured in September 2018. These were essentially at or below the cost I paid for on Amazon. Couldn't return the Amazon one because I had already opened it.
customer_reviews.author: sl

customer_reviews.title: Best smoke/carbon monoxide detector I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: This is a winner all the way around. It’s loud, the smart features are extremely helpful as I have an older furnace and pets and want to be notified if carbon monoxide becomes an issue. The nightlight is helpful as it is on my stairs leading to the lower level.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Strohm

customer_reviews.title: Short life span for a $120 device
customer_reviews.text: I've had two Nest Protects fail. They lasted about three years each. The most recent popped off for a faulty CO sensor. The app states a replacement unit is needed. For perspective, a CO detector costs about $20. A Nest Protect is $120. Why would I buy a $120 unit for a faulty $20 sensor. The Nest Protect sounds like a great idea, but when a sensor fails you're stuck with a pricey fix. Would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: PhiPsi

customer_reviews.title: Age of smoke detector
customer_reviews.text: (2) new ones delivered in April 2020 were manufactured in July 2019. Even after chatting withe Amazon rep, she did not understand the issue after being explained multiple times. She suggested another manufacturers detector, the same one with accessory items, and finally the same detector, but battery powered. So there was no resolution, I requested newer manufactured detectors.
customer_reviews.author: YO Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Burns thru Batteries (1-3 month)
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably easy to set up and get going. For the most part its reasonably on top of events but not perfect. The pitch is pretty high so you wont miss it. The warnings are good when they happen as you can turn off the screaming pitch. You get a lot of random checks especially in relation to batteries and you are supposed to use the Energizer J11 which can have a lifespan of up to a year but can also only last 1-3 months. That said replacing battery every 1-3 months is just too much of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mixed Joy

customer_reviews.title: Why did Google change Nest?!?!
customer_reviews.text: 1st Generation of Nest Protect was easy to install. 2nd Generation is horrible to install: - Different bracket than 1st Generation -- why? - Cheap, cheap plastic. You tighten the screws too much and snap!...plastic cracks.... - Different wired connection that 1st Generation - why? why! When all my Nests finally die I'm going to find a new smoke detector....
customer_reviews.author: Proditoris

product_meta.title: Google S3000BWES Nest Protect Alarm-Smoke Carbon Monoxide Detector, 1, White
product_meta.description: Style:BatteryNest Protect is the smoke alarm that thinks, speaks, and alerts your phone. This smoke detector and carbon monoxide detector has a Split-Spectrum Sensor to detect fast-burning and smoldering fires, tests its own batteries, and lasts up to 10 years. It sends phone alerts when something’s wrong.[1] You can hush the alarm from your phone with App Silence. And it tells you when the batteries are running low, so there are no chirps at 2 AM. [1] Mobile alerts require working internet and Wi-Fi.
feature_bullets: Smoke detector and carbon monoxide detector that speaks up in a friendly voice to give you an early warning when there’s smoke or CO in your home
Split Spectrum Sensor looks for both fast burning and smoldering ﬁres and tells you where the danger is
Get phone alerts so you know something’s wrong even when you’re away from home[1]
CO detector looks out for carbon monoxide and tells you where it’s located
With App Silence, you can silence the smoke alarm with your phone in the Nest app when there’s only a little smoke
No chirps to tell you the battery is low; Nest Protect tests its own batteries and gives you a Nightly Promise when you turn off the lights so you know everything is working
When you walk under Nest Protect at night, Pathlight lights your way
The Nest smoke and carbon monoxide alarm has sensors with a 10-year lifespan to help keep your family safe for up to a decade
With Safety Check, you can test all your smoke and CO alarms with just a tap and get a full report once the test is done
Please refer to the product description section below for all applicable legal disclaimers denoted by the bracketed numbers in the preceding bullet points (e.g., [1], [2], etc.)
Know from anywhere. Connect Nest Protect to Wi-Fi and it will send an alert to your phone if the alarm goes off or the batteries run low.
Tells you what and where. It speaks up to tell you if there’s smoke or CO and where the problem is, so you know what to do. Connectivity: Bluetooth 4.0 LE, Wi-Fi 4 (802.11n)
App Silence. Nest Protect is the first alarm you can hush from your phone. Simply walk to the Nest Protect that noticed the problem and open the Nest app.
Split-Spectrum Sensor. In an emergency, seconds count. Nest Protect uses two wavelengths of light to look for both fast and slow burning fires.
Heads-Up. Get a friendly voice alert so you can handle burning toast before it becomes a burning toaster.
10-year carbon monoxide sensor. Carbon monoxide is odorless, invisible and deadly. When there’s CO, Nest Protect tells you where it’s hiding.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,750 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
